tn.ref: large bronze basin with a bronze stand
tn.text: The stand supported the bronze basin. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:17|30:18]].

tn.ref: He made the basin out of mirrors
tn.text: The bronze came from the mirrors. This can be stated clearly in the translation. AT: "The bronze for the basin came from the mirrors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
A mirror is a piece of polished metal or glass that reflects an image.

tn.text: For 38:17-20, see how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:14|27:16]] and [[:en:bible:notes:exo:27:17|27:17-19]].

tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Bezalel and the workers made the bases for the posts out of bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The hooks and rods for the posts were made of silver, and the covering for the tops of the posts was also made of silver
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They made the hooks, the rods for the posts, and the covering for the tops of the posts out of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They covered the courtyard posts with silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The covering for their tops and its rods were made of silver
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They made the covering for the tops of the posts and their rods out of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: All the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard were made of bronze
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They made all of the tent pegs for the tabernacle and courtyard out of bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur
tn.text: "Bezalel" and "uri" are the name of men. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:31:01|31:1-2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"everything that Yahweh told Moses to do"

tn.ref: an engraver, as a skillful workman, and as an embroiderer
tn.text: "as a skilled engraver and embroiderer"

tn.ref: All the gold that was used for the project
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "All the gold that the people used for the project" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
nine talents ... one hundred talents** - "29 talents ... 100 talents." A talent is 34 kilograms. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
A shekel is 11 grams. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: measured by the standard of the sanctuary shekel
tn.text: There were evidently shekels of more than one weight at the time. This specified which one was to be used. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:30:11|30:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])

tn.ref: The silver given by the community
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The silver which the community gave" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"1/2 a shekel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]])

tn.ref: This figure was reached on the basis of every person who was counted in the census
tn.text: Every man who was 20 years old or older was included in the census and was required to give half a shekel.
"20 years old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: One hundred talents of silver were cast
tn.text: A talent is 34 kilograms. AT: "The workers cast 100 talents of silver" or "The workers cast 3,400 kilograms of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"100 ... 70" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
